FuncDef:
The ptp domain command specifies the domain in which a 1588v2 device resides.
The undo ptp domain command restores the default domain.

A 1588v2 device resides in domain 0 by default.


In G.8275.1 mode, the value ranges from 24 to 43, and the default value is 24.In CU-106 mode, the value ranges from 24 to 43, and the default value is 24.In SMPTE-2059-2 mode, the value ranges from 0 to 127, and the default value is 127.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the clock domain value.
In 1588v2 mode, The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255. The default value is 0.
In G.8275.1 mode, the value ranges from 24 to 43, and the default value is 24.
In CU-106 mode, the value ranges from 24 to 43, and the default value is 24.
In SMPTE-2059-2 mode, the value ranges from 0 to 127, and the default value is 127.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In G.8275.1 mode, the value ranges from 24 to 43, and the default value is 24.In CU-106 mode, the value ranges from 24 to 43, and the default value is 24.In SMPTE-2059-2 mode, the value ranges from 0 to 127, and the default value is 127.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The differences between the configurations of domains for devices of different clock types are as follows:
Configure a domain only in the system view on an OC, a BC, a TC, a T-BC, or a TCOC.Configure a domain in the system view and configure another domain in the TC interface view on a TCandBC.
